intro: Grisebachianthus hypoleucus, commonly known as the white-flowered grisebachianthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
